issue.title: Smooth scrolling does not work with GameActivity on android

repository.name: egui
repository.description: egui: an easy-to-use immediate mode GUI in Rust that runs on both web and native

issue.body:
I started to port my egui app over to GameActivity so that I could start working on android keyboard issues.

PR for this is here:

- https://github.com/damus-io/notedeck/pull/683

One immediate thing I noticed is that scrolling is no longer smooth. Scrolling immediately stops when my finger comes off the screen. I wonder if there is some input difference between GameActivity and NativeActivity @rib ?

Another issue is that on my samsung tablet I get no touch input at all, so there seems to be something subtly broken compared to NativeActivity.

Not sure if anyone else has run into these on android @podusowski @lucasmerlin 

android-acitivty: `0.6.0`
winit version: `v0.30.8` + https://cdn.jb55.com/s/63a01bd8ace40c99.txt
egui version (master @ e8f351b729931db02e2076d81e8454063a2f9911)

issue.title: Android Kinetic scroll is broken on v0.29

body:
Reverting:

- ac2466d14f3461edfe0691c0c1546ea2b263d56a
- https://github.com/emilk/egui/pull/5175

Unbreaks android kinetic scroll

@valadaptive @emilk

I can't run egui on Android easily--can you get debug logging through adb or something?

As I understand it, `response.drag_stopped()` should be true on the one frame that `response.dragged()` stops being true. Is that the case?

issue.title: Fix kinetic scrolling on touch devices

milestone.title: Next Patch Release
milestone.description: Things to be considered for the next patch release

repository.name: egui
repository.description: egui: an easy-to-use immediate mode GUI in Rust that runs on both web and native

issue.body:
Fixes kinetic scrolling on android (and possibly other touch devices), by calculating the final velocity before clearing the position history on PointerGone events.

* Closes #5311 
* [X] I have followed the instructions in the PR template

body:
Thanks for finding this @jb55! 

I digged a bit further and found the root cause:
On android, the `PointerGone` event is triggered when the finger is lifted, which causes the position history to be cleared, thus PointerState.velocity is now zero. 

Opened a PR to fix this by delaying the clearing: https://github.com/emilk/egui/pull/5778

@jb55 @ardocrat can you test if this also fixes kinetic scrolling for you?
